text: i agree with a. kuckartz, later is bad
creator: gregor@apache.org
jann.forrer@id.unizh.ch
text:
I did a load test using jmeter and the content of one of our live sites
(http://www.biologie.unizh.ch). I did two identical test: 

1. Site completely in lenya using tomcat to deliver the pages
2. Static export of the whole site (wget) and then using apache to deliver the
pages. 

Jmeter testplan:
50 concurrent user access 10 times 2 pages (1000 Request)
The first page was the homepage and the  second one a page somewhere deeper in
the sitetree.

Results (summarized):
No error 
Tomcat: 1.5 request/second
Apache: 100 request/second

Maybe we can add a module to generate JMeter test plans, e.g. visit each page of
the publication etc.?
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
+1, worth considering for 1.4.1 imho. or maybe it's a topic for the hackathon?
should not be too hard to do...
creator: nettings@apache.org
